issues.title: Signature data not found.
issues.body:
# IMPORTANT

* [ x ] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/owncloud/news/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed the provided tips

## Explain the Problem
Owncloud returns error:
Some files have not passed the integrity check. Further information on how to resolve this issue can be found in our documentation. (List of invalid files… / Rescan…)
- news
	- EXCEPTION
		- OC\IntegrityCheck\Exceptions\InvalidSignatureException
		- Signature data not found.


## Steps to Reproduce
Explain what you did to encounter the issue
1. Install the news app as directed using news.tar.gz package
2. Uncompress the news package to owncloud/apps/
3. Change the ownership and group of news folder to www-data

## System Information
* News app version: 8.8.0 
* ownCloud version: 10.0.2
* PHP version: 7.0.22
* Database and version: MySQL
* Browser and version: Firefox
* Distribution and version: Ubuntu 16.04


Also, I cannot find News in owncloud Market or Apps menu, is it working as intended?

issues.title: "OCP\AppFramework\Db\DoesNotExistException" when no (unread) articles exist
issues.body:
## Explain the Problem
OwnCloud log shows ```Error	index	OCP\AppFramework\Db\DoesNotExistException: Did expect one result but found none when executing: query "SELECT `items`.* FROM `*PREFIX*news_items` `items` JOIN `*PREFIX*news_feeds` `feeds` ON `feeds`.`id` = `items`.`feed_id` AND `feeds`.`deleted_at` = 0 AND `feeds`.`user_id` = ? AND `items`.`id` = ? LEFT OUTER JOIN `*PREFIX*news_folders` `folders` ON `folders`.`id` = `feeds`.`folder_id` WHERE `feeds`.`folder_id` = 0 OR `folders`.`deleted_at` = 0 ORDER BY `items`.`id` DESC"; parameters Array ( [0] => Username [1] => 13490 ) ; limit ""; offset ""```

## Steps to Reproduce
Sync feeds with iOS app "CloudNews". This results in above pasted error.

## System Information
* News app version: 2.0.2
* ownCloud version: 10.0.1.2
* PHP version: 5.6
* Database and version: MySQL 5.5.55
* Browser and version: not relevant
* Distribution and version: not relevant

What does the error log entry want to let me know? That SQL statement is too much for my basic SQL knowledge :-(

issues.title: Increase News max-version to 10.0
issues.body: Owncloud 10.0 was recently released as the stable version and this app stopped working due to the max-version check. News seems to work just fine on owncloud 10.0 once this change is applied.

issues.title: Wordpress feed not parsed correctly
issues.body:
# IMPORTANT

Read and tick the following checkbox after you have created the issue or place an x inside the brackets ;)

* [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/owncloud/news/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed the provided tips


## Explain the Problem


The feed under https://hk-devblog.com/feed/ does not update or display the newest entries

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Add https://hk-devblog.com/feed/ or https://hk-devblog.com/ as source to OC news
2. Look at the articles it fetches, they are outdated
3. Wait for new articles, they are not reported either

## System Information
* News app version: 8.8.0
* ownCloud version: 9.1.4
* PHP version: php7.0
* Distribution and version: Ubuntu 16.04

issues.title: Add retry button for failed feeds
issues.body:
## Explain the Problem
There is no retry button for broken feeds and it seems that a failed feed won't be retried even if the server got fixed.

## Steps to Reproduce
Explain what you did to encounter the issue
1. Add a feed
2. Hope that the feed will break (because the server is not accessible)
3. The feed has a yellow background and when you move the cursor on it, there is the title `Update failed more than 50 times...`
4. Fix the server providing the feed
5. I don't know what to do to get the feed working again

## System Information
* News app version: `9.0.4`
* ownCloud version: `9.1.4.2`
* PHP version: `7.0.15`
* Database and version: `mariadb 10.0.29`
* Browser and version: `firefox 51.0.1`
* Distribution and version: `ubuntu 16.04.2`

## Contents of owncloud/data/owncloud.log

```json
```

## Contents of Browser Error Console

```
```

issues.title: old feed items are will not be deleted
issues.body:
Read and tick the following checkbox after you have created the issue or place an x inside the brackets ;)

* [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/owncloud/news/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed the provided tips


## Explain the Problem
old news items are not deleted. my database by now is about 500MB (only the items-table) with 91385 items. i count 31 feeds.
feeds get updated by owncloud cronjob which runs as php-script every hour without errors.

examining the status i get the following result
```sql
SELECT count(status), status FROM `oc_news_items` group by status


count(status)	status	
5621	0	
85751	2	
13	4	 
```

## System Information
* News app version: current stable
* ownCloud version: 8.2.9
* PHP version: 5.6.30
* Database and version: 5.5
* Distribution and version: ubuntu 12.04

## Contents of owncloud/data/owncloud.log
```json
{"reqId":"uLHk8igMCJOgfox6xwO2","remoteAddr":"178.25.191.165","app":"news","message":"Configuration value \"simplePieCacheDuration\" does not exist. Ignored value.","level":2,"time":"2017-02-19T16:09:17+00:00"}
{"reqId":"zMNXneDKKf\/dbshZMghR","remoteAddr":"178.25.191.165","app":"PHP","message":"Automatically populating $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. To avoid this warning set 'always_populate_raw_post_data' to '-1' in php.ini and use the php:\/\/input stream instead. at Unknown#0","level":3,"time":"2017-02-19T16:20:45+00:00"}
```

## content of owncloud/data/news/config/config.ini
```
autoPurgeMinimumInterval = 60
autoPurgeCount = 200
maxRedirects = 10
maxSize = 104857600
```

issues.title: Can't see any feed

## Explain the Problem
What problem did you encounter?
Can't see any feed content.

## Steps to Reproduce
Explain what you did to encounter the issue
1. I downloaded news app archive as described "Go to the ownCloud News GitHub releases page and download the latest release/archive to your server"
2. I enabled the app, updated the db.
3. When I click on any feed, I can see just the spinner loading and in data/owncloud.log i have the error above.

issues.title: Display feed icon in articles
issues.body:
* [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/owncloud/news/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed the provided tips

## Explain the Problem
When reading news on the website (e.g. "unread articles") it's hard to see to which feed a article belongs to. There is only the feed title written in light grey below the article title.
I think it would be better to display the icon of the feed next to the feed title.

## System Information
* News app version: `9.0.4`
* ownCloud version: `9.1.2`

### Current:
![spectacle l28327](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5571650/20723403/adb51c7c-b66a-11e6-92a5-8f3a661f4db8.png)
### Better:
![better](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5571650/20723991/e898e9fc-b66c-11e6-9889-f9938d861569.png)

issues.title: Modify feed URLs in user interface
issues.body:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/owncloud/news/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed the provided tips

Some feeds changes their feed URL from time to time (e.g. moving to `https://`). I found no option to change the URL of existing feeds.

I'd suggest adding a button to the context menu of feeds to change the feed URL (it's possible to change the name of the feed but not the URL).

issues.title: Error: this app cannot be enabled because it makes the server unstable
issues.body:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/owncloud/news/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed the provided tips
## Explain the Problem

When enabling the plugin, on a new installation of owncloud, on a Centos 7 box.
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Install owncloud via RPM
   (i end up with: owncloud-9.0.4-1.el7.remi.noarch)
2. Clone the plugin via git clone
3. Try to enable it via admin interface. It fails with the error "Error: this app cannot be enabled because it makes the server unstable"
## System Information
- News app version: lateest 
- ownCloud version: 9.0.4
- PHP version: php-common-5.6.26-1.el7.remi
- Database and version: mariadb-server-5.5.50
- Distribution and version: Centos7 (with remi enabled)
## Contents of owncloud/data/owncloud.log

``` json
Nothing!

```

Httpd logs:

``` json
==> /var/log/httpd/access_log <==

==> /var/log/httpd/error_log <==
[Sun Sep 18 02:17:25.504896 2016] [:error] [pid 31005] [client 192.168.0.32:54694] PHP Fatal error:  require_once(): Failed opening required '/usr/share/owncloud/apps/news/appinfo/../vendor/autoload.php' (include_path='/usr/share/owncloud/lib/private:/usr/share/owncloud/config:/usr/share/owncloud/3rdparty:/usr/share/owncloud/apps:/var/lib/owncloud/apps:.:/usr/share/pear:/usr/share/php:/usr/share/owncloud') in /usr/share/owncloud/apps/news/appinfo/app.php on line 16

==> /var/log/httpd/access_log <==
192.168.0.32 - - [18/Sep/2016:02:17:25 -0300] "GET /owncloud/index.php/apps/files HTTP/1.1" 500 - "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Fedora; Linux x86_64; rv:48.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/48.0"
192.168.0.32 - - [18/Sep/2016:02:17:25 -0300] "POST /owncloud/index.php/disableapp HTTP/1.1" 200 20 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Fedora; Linux x86_64; rv:48.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/48.0"
```

There is any workaround? this app represenets about 70 % of my owncloud use.

issues.title: Missing Cron "Customer Updater" help page
issues.body:
Read and tick the following checkbox after you have created the issue or place an x inside the brackets ;)
- [ x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/owncloud/news/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed the provided tips
## Explain the Problem

Missing help page on github to do with setting up cron. Message appears at top of link and reads "How to set up a custom updater (faster and no possible deadlock)" it  links to this page: https://github.com/owncloud/news/wiki/Custom-Updater
## Steps to Reproduce

Explain what you did to encounter the issue
1. Opened News app (cron is set to use AJAX)
1. Clicked on link in message at top.
## System Information
- News app version: 7.1.2
- ownCloud version: 9.0.4

issues.title: Feed http-auth settings may accidently leak owncloud login to 3rd party sites
issues.body:
The input fields used in the expandable  _Advanced settings_ panel contain input elements for Username and Password that will be used to retrieve the feed over HTTP.

Since the two input elements for username and password use the same "name" parameter as the ones in the owncloud login, at least my firefox and chrome auto-fill them as soon as they appear (after I expanded the _Advanced settings_).
## Steps to Reproduce

Explain what you did to encounter the issue
1. Save your OC login credentials in the browser
2. Go to the news app, Subscribe to new feed
3. Click on _Advanced settings_ and watch if the browser auto-fills your OC credentials for this feed.
## Implications

This behavior can lead the user to accidentally expose his OC login credentials to the feed provider.
At the same time it risks that the users password is stored in plain-text in the OC database.
## System Information
- News app version: 8.8.0
- ownCloud version: nextcloud 9.0.53
- Browser and version: Firefox 48.0 / Chromium Version 52.0.2743.116

issues.title: Android login error: Something went wrong :(   - cannot login to News with Android App
issues.body:
I'm running Nextcloud 9.0.50 (stable).  I have tried to login to News with two different android devices and receive the message Error: Something went wrong  -- 

Additionally, I successfully used the Import Account utility to capture the correct URL.

Thanks for the work on this very important app I'm looking forward to using it on my portable devices.

Wayne

issues.title: OC 9.1 and News 8.8.0 does not play well: Class '\OCP\Backgroundjob' not found in /var/www/owncloud/apps/news/config/appconfig.php
issues.body:

Read and tick the following checkbox after you have created the issue or place an x inside the brackets ;)

## Explain the Problem

Enabling the news 8.8.0 app in ownCloud 9.1 results in immediate failure:

PHP Fatal error:  Class '\OCP\Backgroundjob' not found in /var/www/owncloud/apps/news/config/appconfig.php on line 88
## Steps to Reproduce

Explain what you did to encounter the issue
1. Upgrade OC from 9.0.4 to 9.1
2. occ app:enable news
3. do anything, visit web page, or run 'occ'.
## System Information

- ownCloud version: 9.1.0

issues.title: Unable to enable app on 32bit OS since OC 9.1
issues.body:
## Explain the Problem

After update to OC 9.1 I can not activate news 8.8.0 due to this error:

> This app cannot be installed because the following dependencies are not fulfilled:
> 64bit or higher PHP required.
## Steps to Reproduce

update from 9.0 to 9.1
## System Information
- News app version: 8.8.0
- ownCloud version: 9.1
- PHP version: 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
- Database and version: 10.0.25-MariaDB-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
- Browser and version: Google Chrome 51.0.2704.103 (64-bit)
- Distribution and version: Ubuntu 16.04 server
- Architecture: armhf 32 bit
## Contents of owncloud/data/owncloud.log


What problem did you encounter?

## Steps to Reproduce

1.Install News plugin on nas Synology (DSM6)

## Contents of owncloud/data/owncloud.log

``` json

{"reqId":"SteZJrf2EUV3ou07SggG","remoteAddr":"xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx","app":"webdav","message":"Exception: {\"Message\":\"HTTP\\\/1.1 401 No 'Authorization: Basic' header found. Either the client didn't send one, or the server is mis-configured\",\"Exception\":\"Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Exception\\\\NotAuthenticated\",\"Code\":0,\"Trace\":\"#0 [internal function]: Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Auth\\\\Plugin->beforeMethod(Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Request), Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Response))\\n#1 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/event\\\/lib\\\/EventEmitterTrait.php(105): call_user_func_array(Array, Array)\\n#2 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(446): Sabre\\\\Event\\\\EventEmitter->emit('beforeMethod', Array)\\n#3 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(248): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->invokeMethod(Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Request), Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Response))\\n#4 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/apps\\\/dav\\\/appinfo\\\/v1\\\/webdav.php(55): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->exec()\\n#5 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/remote.php(138): require_once('\\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/ow...')\\n#6 {main}\",\"File\":\"\\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Auth\\\/Plugin.php\",\"Line\":188,\"User\":\"*****\"}","level":0,"time":"2016-06-27T16:12:16+00:00","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/owncloud\/remote.php\/webdav\/Application\/","user":"****"}

To avoid this warning set 'always_populate_raw_post_data' to '-1' in php.ini and use the php:\/\/input stream instead. at Unknown#0","level":3,"time":"2016-06-27T16:15:59+00:00","method":"POST","url":"\/owncloud\/index.php\/heartbeat","user":"****"}
{"reqId":"r8Eo2mg5pGLCzsJQg\/wE","remoteAddr":"xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx","app":"PHP","message":"Automatically populating $HTTP_RAW_POST_DATA is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. To avoid this warning set 'always_populate_raw_post_data' to '-1' in php.ini and use the php:\/\/input stream instead. at Unknown#0","level":3,"time":"2016-06-27T16:16:16+00:00","method":"POST","url":"\/owncloud\/index.php\/heartbeat","user":"*****"}
{"reqId":"LhHZ4OFlruM9ogaNQTEj","remoteAddr":"xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx","app":"webdav","message":"Exception: {\"Message\":\"HTTP\\\/1.1 401 No 'Authorization: Basic' header found. Either the client didn't send one, or the server is mis-configured\",\"Exception\":\"Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Exception\\\\NotAuthenticated\",\"Code\":0,\"Trace\":\"#0 [internal function]: Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Auth\\\\Plugin->beforeMethod(Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Request), Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Response))\\n#1 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/event\\\/lib\\\/EventEmitterTrait.php(105): call_user_func_array(Array, Array)\\n#2 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(446): Sabre\\\\Event\\\\EventEmitter->emit('beforeMethod', Array)\\n#3 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(248): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->invokeMethod(Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Request), Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Response))\\n#4 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/apps\\\/dav\\\/appinfo\\\/v1\\\/webdav.php(55): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->exec()\\n#5 \\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/remote.php(138): require_once('\\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/ow...')\\n#6 {main}\",\"File\":\"\\\/volume1\\\/web\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Auth\\\/Plugin.php\",\"Line\":188,\"User\":false}","level":0,"time":"2016-06-27T16:21:31+00:00","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/owncloud\/remote.php\/webdav\/Application\/","user":"--"}

```

Those errors are from caldav & cardav.
I have check:

```
Check if the config.ini in owncloud/data/news/config/config.ini contains useCronUpdates = true
Check if you are using the system cron (Cron) setting on the admin page. AJAX and Web cron will not update feeds
Check if the cronjob exists with crontab -u www-data -e (replace www-data with your httpd user)
Check the file permissions of the cron.php file and if www-data (or whatever your httpd user is called like) can read and execute that script
Check if you can execute the cron with sudo -u www-data php -f owncloud/cron.php (replace www-data with your httpd user)
Check your data/owncloud.log for errors
Check if the cronjob is ever executed by placing an error_log('updating'); in the background job file. If the cronjob runs, there should be an updating log statement in your httpd log.
If there is no updating statement in your logs check if your cronjob is executed by executing a different script
If your cron works fine but owncloud's cronjobs are never executed, file a bug in core
```

Cron execute fine, he is logged into administration page.

Thx for the help :)

issues.title: Published time on feeds
issues.body:
Hi,

First of all thanks for this great app!
Yesterday i have migrated from Feedly to ownCloud News app.
Eveything seems fine except a "problem" with the items timestamp.

Feedly seems to be based on the `<published>` feed tag and ownCloud News is based on the `<updated>` feed tag to create the item timestamp.

![ownnote](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1951866/14762157/02bb1a90-0974-11e6-8fed-a1e7f8bf994b.png)

![feedly](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1951866/14762158/05bb33ec-0974-11e6-8667-a2f90ebcb3dc.png)

![rss](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1951866/14762185/a4a50ab4-0974-11e6-8b21-fc5eeb7b098b.png)

For example on a Youtube RSS feeds channels the updated timestamp is over and over updated so the timestamp is not accurate for me (see screenshots and [this feed](https://www.youtube.com/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=UCR4s1DE9J4DHzZYXMltSMAg))

Is there an option to only display published date and not updated date in the column ?

I saw a bugfix on 4.2.0 release, maybe it is related ? :

> Ignore Atom updated tag if it is earlier than the published tag

ownCloud : 9.0.1
ownCloud News: 8.7.1

Thanks!

issues.title: API 2.0
issues.body:
In addition to the old APIs I'd like to modernize the API since it seems more complicated than it needs to be and a lot of REST things are used in a wrong way

The main goals are the following
- Move the shitty version in the URL from vX-X to a semantically versioned URL, e.g. /api/2.0.0/ or remove the version from the URL entirely by sending an HTTP request header (News-Api-Version: 2.0.0)
- Use HTTP cache headers instead of requiring you to pass a last modified date
- Crack down on the number of URLs, e.g. marking an item as read and starred would become 
  - **PATCH /items/1** 
  
  ``` json
  {"read": true, "starred": true, "fingerprint": "some_hash"}
  ```
- Actions on multiple resources should be handled at the correct endpoint, e.g. marking multiple items as read and starred would look like this: 
  - **PATCH /items** 
  
  ``` json
  [
    {"id": 123, "read": true, "starred": true, "fingerprint": "some_hash"}, 
    {"id": 124, "read": true, "starred": true, "fingerprint": "some_hash"}
  ]
  ```
- Get rid of the id vs feedid + guidhash difference. I thought this was useful once, but we did not need it
- Also implement a modified date for feeds and folders so you don't have to fetch everything all over again
- Provide helper routes to make syncing a breeze. You normally have three usecases, those should be reflected by three routes
  - Initial sync: Fetch feeds, folders, unread + starred items: **GET /api/2.0.0/sync**
  - Sync local changes (no return appart from errors because the next GET request fetches all changed items anyways):  **POST /api/2.0.0/sync** 
  
  ``` json
  {"items": [{"id": 1, "read": true, "fingerprint": "some_hash"}]}
  ```
  
    The fingerprint is a hash over the title, url, content and enclosures and if it is the same in the current database, only the status (read/starred) will be returned to the client.
  - Checking for new contents without changes:: **GET /api/2.0.0/sync**  + http cache headers

The response will be the changes.

Furthermore creating feeds/folders that already exist should respond with the existing object instead of just returning an error message. This makes it very easy to create folders: you just submit the contents and if you get a 409 you just use the returned contents.

Ideas? Suggestions?

@David-Development @phedlund @icewind1991 @jangernert @cosenal

You don’t want an option, you just want it to happen. Attachments should be prefetched just like feeds, although probably with a reasonable expiry of attachments older than … 2 weeks or so, that the space doesn’t get filled up.

@kaffeeringe node.js is just used for compiling Coffeescript to JS. It’s only needed in the development process (much like we use some other scripts for the translations). The releases don’t have any Coffeescript, just the pure JS.

And thank you all for your work!

Can't be unit tested since this requires a filesystem. Pass in a view into the constructor. Take a look at utility/config.php
Pass in and use simple pie file factory. Check articleenhancer.php
Can't be tested without filesystem. Same applies for all other image functions
No need to md5 time ;)
Got one here https://github.com/owncloud/contacts/blob/master/lib/imageresponse.php
Awesome :)

Yeah, I also don't like it so much here. But let me explain: The main things done here are turning relative image-/favicon-paths in absolute URLs and the deletion of the attachments of feeds/items. - the deletion of attachments can actually be done in the business layer, so i agree here and I will move the functionality - but the URLs have to be modified on every request of an item (resp. feed). If this is not done here, every business layer function that returns items (resp. feeds) must do this (e.g. call a modifyURLs-function). So I think it could be better to do it at a central point right after they get out of the database.?

Yes, I think you are right here, even if I don't like the idea of loading every image by PHP. This is definitely a bottleneck for feeds with many images and "small" servers. Ideally the request will be handled solely by the HTTP-server via its rewrite-engine. Is it possible to provide a .htaccess-file with the News app? Then we could use the functionality here as fallback.

review_comments.body:
It is activated by default (www.php.net/manual/en/simplexml.installation.php).
But because it can be disabled and to keep the code uniform, I better switch to domdocument. ;)
Thanks a lot! I was looking for something like that. I think I was confused because of the name "view"...
I can hardly imagine why I did that. It absolutely doesn't make sense...
I dont think we can ship a custom .htaccess for that, at least we cant override the parent one. You might want to check which urls are accessible without login.
I see, you may want to put it into the itembusinesslayer then. There are only two methods that return items and you can reuse a private method.
I mean this :) https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/lib/files/view.php

Ok, I agree, thank you! :)

Memo for me: Also handle folder-deletions in folderbusinesslayer.
